alert.note: Alert for Macomb (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 25 at 7:23AM EDT until further notice by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... North Branch Clinton Near Mt Clemens affecting Macomb County. Clinton River Near Clinton Township affecting Macomb County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Clinton River Near Clinton Township. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EDT Friday the stage was 17.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 7.4 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Impact...At 17.0 feet, Water dams up against the Garfield, Utica and Hayes Road bridges, causing the river level on the upstream side of the bridges to be higher than what the river gauge will read downstream. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
